news_header: Mohammed, a civil engineer in southern Lebanon, survived an air strike while distributing food to neighbors. He recounts the chaos and injuries sustained during the attack, highlighting the plight of civilians amidst ongoing violence.
news_text: Mohammed, a 29-year-old civil engineer, was distributing hot meals to elderly neighbors when an air strike hit his village in southern Lebanon, causing severe injuries to him and his friends. He describes the aftermath of the explosion, the lack of warning, and the civilian nature of the targeted areas. The local hospital, overwhelmed with casualties from daily air strikes, struggles to provide care amidst dwindling resources. Despite the dangers, local emergency responders remain committed to helping their community, even as they face personal losses and the constant threat of violence.
